page.title: 19THE ORCADIAN DIALECT IN EDAY
page.content: The orcadian language is very different from English, for example instead of saying "mud" Orcadians would say "gutter". The language is called Orcadian meaning from the Orkney Islands and it probably originated from Old Norse when the Vikings settled here. Here are some other words commonly used in Eday, written in Orcadian first then in English. Skeldo means oyster catcher Whap means curlew Peedie means small Selkie means seal Eday means island of eith or isthmus Pronunciation is also rather different, some examples are house is hoos' and mouse is moos'. Perhaps these words will be of help to visitors to Orkney.
